> I agree that this seems to be too much for simple search engine queries,
OTH
> I think it is a good idea to create a new resource for the 'information
> retrieval interaction', because it opens up the possibility for more
complex
> retrieval tasks: You could distribute the URI of that resource to various
> 'information retrieval systems/agents' that can GET the query parameters
from
> it and POST the results to it. At any time, you could do a GET on the
resource
> to see the current 'retrieval state', much like you can GET the state of a
> shipping order to track the delivery.
>
> I am curious: How do your queries look like?
>
> Jan
>


a typical structure could be:

[ ( weight, [ (weight, term)+ ] )+ ]

with [ ] and ( ) beeing arrays and sequences (as in python or prolog)
